briefdescription.para: Bit in ctrl or ctrl_stat associated with alarm 1.
Bit in ctrl or ctrl_stat associated with alarm 2.
ctrl bit for alarm 1 interrupt enable.
ctrl bit for alarm 2 interrupt enable.
ctrl bit for ISQ functionality.

detaileddescription.para: When clear the ISW signal provides a square wave. When set the ISW signal indicates alarm events.

simplesect.para: The driver expects to be able to control this bit.

briefdescription.para: ctrl bit offset for square wave output frequency.

simplesect.para: The driver will control the content of this field.

briefdescription.para: ctrl mask to isolate RS bits.
ctrl RS field value for 1 Hz square wave.
ctrl RS field value for 1024 Hz square wave.
ctrl RS field value for 4096 Hz square wave.
ctrl RS field value for 8192 Hz square wave.
ctrl bit to write to trigger temperature conversion.
ctrl bit to write to enable square wave output in battery mode.
ctrl bit to write to disable the oscillator.
ctrl_stat bit indicating alarm1 has triggered.

detaileddescription.para: If an alarm callback handler is registered this bit is cleared prior to invoking the callback with the flags indicating which alarms are ready.

briefdescription.para: ctrl_stat bit indicating alarm2 has triggered.

detaileddescription.para: If an alarm callback handler is registered this bit is cleared prior to invoking the callback with the flags indicating which alarms are ready.

briefdescription.para: Flag indicating a temperature conversion is in progress.
Set to enable 32 KiHz open drain signal.

simplesect.para: This is a control bit, though it is positioned within the ctrl_stat register which otherwise contains status bits.

briefdescription.para: Flag indicating the oscillator has been off since last cleared.
Control alarm behavior on match in seconds field.

detaileddescription.para: If clear the alarm fires only when the RTC seconds matches the alarm seconds.
If set the alarm seconds field is ignored and an alarm will be triggered every second. The bits for IGNMN, IGNHR, and IGNDA must all be set.
This bit must be clear for the second alarm instance.
Bit maps to A1M1 and is used in maxim_ds3231_alarm_configuration::alarm_flags.

briefdescription.para: Control alarm behavior on match in minutes field.

detaileddescription.para: If clear the alarm fires only when the RTC minutes matches the alarm minutes. The bit for IGNSE must be clear.
If set the alarm minutes field is ignored and alarms will be triggered based on IGNSE. The bits for IGNHR and IGNDA must both be set.
Bit maps to A1M2 or A2M2 and is used in maxim_ds3231_alarm_configuration::alarm_flags.

briefdescription.para: Control alarm behavior on match in hours field.

detaileddescription.para: If clear the alarm fires only when the RTC hours matches the alarm hours. The bits for IGNMN and IGNSE must be clear.
If set the alarm hours field is ignored and alarms will be triggered based on IGNMN and IGNSE. The bit for IGNDA must be set.
Bit maps to A1M3 or A2M3 and is used in maxim_ds3231_alarm_configuration::alarm_flags.

briefdescription.para: Control alarm behavior on match in day/date field.

detaileddescription.para: If clear the alarm fires only when the RTC day/date matches the alarm day/date, mediated by MAXIM_DS3231_ALARM_FLAGS_DAY. The bits for IGNHR, IGNMN, and IGNSE must be clear
If set the alarm day/date field is ignored and an alarm will be triggered based on IGNHR, IGNMN, and IGNSE.
Bit maps to A1M4 or A2M4 and is used in maxim_ds3231_alarm_configuration::alarm_flags.

briefdescription.para: Control match on day of week versus day of month.

detaileddescription.para: Set the flag to match on day of week; clear it to match on day of month.
Bit maps to DY/DTn in corresponding maxim_ds3231_alarm_configuration::alarm_flags.

briefdescription.para: Indicates that the alarm should be disabled once it fires.

detaileddescription.para: Set the flag in the maxim_ds3231_alarm_configuration::alarm_flags field to cause the alarm to be disabled when the interrupt fires, prior to invoking the corresponding handler.
Leave false to allow the alarm to remain enabled so it will fire again on the next match.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* maxim_ds3231_alarm_callback_handler_t) (const struct device *dev, uint8_t id, uint32_t syncclock, void *user_data)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct device *dev, uint8_t id, uint32_t syncclock, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: maxim_ds3231_alarm_callback_handler_t

briefdescription.para: Signature for DS3231 alarm callbacks.

detaileddescription.para: The alarm callback is invoked from the system work queue thread. At the point the callback is invoked the corresponding alarm flags will have been cleared from the device status register. The callback is permitted to invoke operations on the device.

parameterdescription.para: the device from which the callback originated
the alarm id
the value from maxim_ds3231_read_syncclock() at the time the alarm interrupt was processed.
the corresponding parameter from maxim_ds3231_alarm::user_data.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* maxim_ds3231_notify_callback) (const struct device *dev, struct sys_notify *notify, int res)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const struct device *dev, struct sys_notify *notify, int res)
memberdef.name: maxim_ds3231_notify_callback

briefdescription.para: Signature used to notify a user of the DS3231 that an asynchronous operation has completed.

detaileddescription.para: Functions compatible with this type are subject to all the constraints of sys_notify_generic_callback.

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer
the notification structure provided in the call
the result of the operation.

briefdescription.para: Read the local synchronization clock.

detaileddescription.para: Synchronization aligns the DS3231 real-time clock with a stable monotonic local clock which should have a frequency between 1 kHz and 1 MHz and be itself synchronized with the primary system time clock. The accuracy of the alignment and the maximum time between synchronization updates is affected by the resolution of this clock.

On some systems the hardware clock from k_cycles_get_32() is suitable, but on others that clock advances too quickly. The frequency of the target-specific clock is provided by maxim_ds3231_syncclock_frequency().
At this time the value is captured from k_uptime_get_32(); future kernel extensions may make a higher-resolution clock available.

simplesect.para: This function is isr-ok.

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer

simplesect.para: the current value of the synchronization clock.

briefdescription.para: Get the frequency of the synchronization clock.

detaileddescription.para: Provides the frequency of the clock used in maxim_ds3231_read_syncclock().

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer

simplesect.para: the frequency of the selected synchronization clock.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint8_t set_bits, uint8_t clear_bits)
memberdef.name: maxim_ds3231_ctrl_update

briefdescription.para: Set and clear specific bits in the control register.

simplesect.para: This function assumes the device register cache is valid. It will not read the register value, and it will write to the device only if the value changes as a result of applying the set and clear changes.
Unlike maxim_ds3231_stat_update() the return value from this function indicates the register value after changes were made. That return value is cached for use in subsequent operations.
This function is supervisor.
the non-negative updated value of the register, or a negative error code from an I2C transaction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint8_t set_bits, uint8_t clear_bits)
memberdef.name: maxim_ds3231_stat_update

briefdescription.para: Read the ctrl_stat register then set and clear bits in it.

detaileddescription.para: The content of the ctrl_stat register will be read, then the set and clear bits applied and the result written back to the device (regardless of whether there appears to be a change in value).

OSF, A1F, and A2F will be written with 1s if the corresponding bits do not appear in either set_bits or clear_bits. This ensures that if any flag becomes set between the read and the write that indicator will not be cleared.

simplesect.para: Unlike maxim_ds3231_ctrl_update() the return value from this function indicates the register value before any changes were made.
This function is supervisor.

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer
bits to be set when writing back. Setting bits other than MAXIM_DS3231_REG_STAT_EN32kHz will have no effect.
bits to be cleared when writing back. Include the bits for the status flags you want to clear.

simplesect.para: the non-negative register value as originally read (disregarding the effect of clears and sets), or a negative error code from an I2C transaction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint8_t id, struct maxim_ds3231_alarm *cfg)
memberdef.name: maxim_ds3231_get_alarm

briefdescription.para: Read a DS3231 alarm configuration.

detaileddescription.para: The alarm configuration data is read from the device and reconstructed into the output parameter.

simplesect.para: This function is supervisor.

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer.
the alarm index, which must be 0 (for the 1 s resolution alarm) or 1 (for the 1 min resolution alarm).
a pointer to a structure into which the configured alarm data will be stored.

simplesect.para: a non-negative value indicating successful conversion, or a negative error code from an I2C transaction or invalid parameter.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint8_t id, const struct maxim_ds3231_alarm *cfg)
memberdef.name: maxim_ds3231_set_alarm

briefdescription.para: Configure a DS3231 alarm.

detaileddescription.para: The alarm configuration is validated and stored into the device.
To cancel an alarm use counter_cancel_channel_alarm().

simplesect.para: This function is supervisor.

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer.
0 Analog to counter index. ALARM1 is 0 and has 1 s resolution, ALARM2 is 1 and has 1 minute resolution.
a pointer to the desired alarm configuration. Both alarms are configured; if only one is to change the application must supply the existing configuration for the other.

simplesect.para: a non-negative value on success, or a negative error code from an I2C transaction or an invalid parameter.

briefdescription.para: Synchronize the RTC against the local clock.

detaileddescription.para: The RTC advances one tick per second with no access to sub-second precision. Synchronizing clocks at sub-second resolution requires enabling a 1pps signal then capturing the system clocks in a GPIO callback. This function provides that operation.
Synchronization is performed in asynchronously, and may take as long as 1 s to complete; notification of completion is provided through the notify parameter.
Applications should use maxim_ds3231_get_syncpoint() to retrieve the synchronization data collected by this operation.

simplesect.para: This function is supervisor.

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer.
pointer to the object used to specify asynchronous function behavior and store completion information.
on success
if a synchronization or set is currently in progress
if notify is not provided
if the required interrupt is not configured

briefdescription.para: Request to update the synchronization point.

detaileddescription.para: This is a variant of maxim_ds3231_synchronize() for use from user threads.

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer.
pointer to a valid and ready-to-be-signalled k_poll_signal. May be NULL to request a synchronization point be collected without notifying when it has been updated.
on success
if a synchronization or set is currently in progress
if the required interrupt is not configured

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the most recent synchronization point.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the synchronization data last captured using maxim_ds3231_synchronize().

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer.
where to store the synchronization data.
on success
if no syncpoint has been captured

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, const struct maxim_ds3231_syncpoint *syncpoint, struct sys_notify *notify)
memberdef.name: maxim_ds3231_set

briefdescription.para: Set the RTC to a time consistent with the provided synchronization.

detaileddescription.para: The RTC advances one tick per second with no access to sub-second precision, and setting the clock resets the internal countdown chain. This function implements the magic necessary to set the clock while retaining as much sub-second accuracy as possible. It requires a synchronization point that pairs sub-second resolution civil time with a local synchronization clock captured at the same instant. The set operation may take as long as 1 second to complete; notification of completion is provided through the notify parameter.

simplesect.para: This function is supervisor.

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer.
the structure providing the synchronization point.
pointer to the object used to specify asynchronous function behavior and store completion information.
on success
if syncpoint or notify are null
if the required interrupt signal is not configured
if a synchronization or set is currently in progress

briefdescription.para: Check for and clear flags indicating that an alarm has fired.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a mask indicating alarms that are marked as having fired, and clears from stat the flags that it found set. Alarms that have been configured with a callback are not represented in the return value.
This API may be used when a persistent alarm has been programmed.

simplesect.para: This function is supervisor.

parameterdescription.para: the DS3231 device pointer.

simplesect.para: a non-negative value that may have MAXIM_DS3231_ALARM1 and/or MAXIM_DS3231_ALARM2 set, or a negative error code.

briefdescription.para: Real-time clock control based on the DS3231 counter API.

detaileddescription.para: The Maxim DS3231 is a high-precision real-time clock with temperature-compensated crystal oscillator and support for configurable alarms.

The core Zephyr API to this device is as a counter, with the following limitations:
counter_read() and counter_*_alarm() cannot be invoked from interrupt context, as they require communication with the device over an I2C bus.
many other counter APIs, such as start/stop/set_top_value are not supported as the clock is always running.
two alarm channels are supported but are not equally capable: channel 0 supports alarms at 1 s resolution, while channel 1 supports alarms at 1 minute resolution.

Most applications for this device will need to use the extended functionality exposed by this header to access the real-time-clock features. The majority of these functions must be invoked from supervisor mode.
